Based on the provided document, the RLMS refers to Reinforcement Learning for Multimodal Input Data. This is a research approach mentioned in the progress report within the context of a PhD student's work on multimodal summarization. There's no further information about what RLMS is beyond this application within their research.

Based on the provided documents, the RLMS refers to a Reinforcement Learning Model for Multimodal Input Data. This is a research project focusing on multimodal summarization, a key area within the scholar's research. The documents detail progress on this research, including publications, conference presentations, and patent applications related to this model and its applications in areas such as fake news detection and healthcare summarization.
about rlms and full form about it?

Based on the provided text, RLMS stands for Reinforcement Learning for Multimodal Input Data. This is explicitly stated in the progress report under the bullet point describing a research paper communicated to IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence.

Based on the provided document, Phani (Signamannetty Venkata Phanindra Kumar) is a doctoral research scholar at SRM University-AP, Andhra Pradesh, India. His research focuses on multimodal summarization using deep neural networks.

Here's a summary of the information available:

  • Research Topic: Multimodal summarization using deep neural networks.
  • Supervisor: Dr. Asnu Abdul
  • Co-Supervisor: Dr. Jatindra Kumar Dash
  • Enrollment Date: May 10, 2021
  • Progress Report Period: 01.01.2024 to 30.06.2024
  • Recent Activities:
    • Completed a Comprehensive Viva.
    • Presented research at the 5th International Conference for Data Science and Applications (ICDSA 2024).
    • Published several papers and has several patents pending related to multimodal summarization, fake news detection, and healthcare summarization.
    • Completed a meeting with the doctoral committee and received a one-year extension.
  • Internship: He has a 9-month internship with VOLVO from June 2024 to May 2025, working 2 weeks at the VOLVO office and 2 weeks at the university each month.

The documents show significant research progress and publications. More detailed information on specific publications and patent applications can be gleaned from the patent application numbers provided.

Here's a list based on the provided images. It appears to be a progress report for a Ph.D. scholar. The list categorizes the accomplishments for the reporting period:

Research Activities:

  • Literature Review & Gap Analysis: Reading research papers on multimodal summarization, identifying gaps in the literature.
  • Research Paper Completion: Completed a comprehensive research paper. The title is partially visible in the image: "Improving preliminary clinical diagnosis accuracy through knowledge filtering techniques in consultation dialogues"
  • Research Paper Submissions:
    • Submitted a research paper titled "Machine Intelligence Input Data in Multimodal Summarization Approach for Multimodal Input Data" to IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence.
    • Submitted a research paper titled "Multilingual Multimodal Summarization by Fine-tuning Transformers" to IEEE Conference.
  • Conference Paper Presentation: Presented a conference paper titled "MMSMI – Multilingual Multimodal Summarization for Data Science and Applications" at the 5th International Conference on Data Science and Applications (ICDSA 2024).
  • Conference Attendance: Attended a research and recognition summit.

Patent Applications:

  • Patent application for a system and a method for prediction of the strength of concrete. Application No: 202341087257.
  • Patent application for a system and a method for generating trading coupons. Application No: 202341087665.
  • Patent application for a system and a method for deriving multilingual meeting minutes. Application No: 202441001022.
  • Patent application for a system and a method for personalized e-content generation based on student performance in education. Application No: 20241003347.
  • Patent application for a system and a method for multilingual fake news detection in multimodal information. Patent Application No: 20241003030.
  • Patent application for a healthcare summarization system and a method thereof. Patent Application No: 20241005845.

Meetings & Administrative:

  • Meeting with Doctoral Committee: Completed a meeting with the doctoral committee and received a one-year extension.
  • Internship: Secured a 9-month internship at VOLVO (hybrid model).

Appendices:

  • Semester progress report
  • Doctoral committee meeting minutes
  • Copy of publications (first page only)

This list summarizes the key achievements and activities mentioned in the provided progress report. Please note that some information is partially obscured in the images, leading to incomplete titles or details.

Based on the provided progress report, RLMS stands for Reinforcement Learning based Multimodal Summarization. It's the name of a research paper communicated by the authors, focusing on a multimodal summarization approach designed to handle multimodal input data. The paper was published in IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence.
